upload.title: The file converter you'll love.
upload.subtitle: All image, audio, and document processing is done on your device. No file size limit.

tooltip.partial_support: This format can only be converted as {direction}.
tooltip.video_server_processing: Video uploads to a server for processing by default, learn how to set it up locally here.

archive_file.extracted: Extracted {extract_count} files from {filename}. {ignore_count} items were ignored.

convert.large_file_warning: Due to browser / device limitations, video to audio conversion is disabled for this file as it is larger than {limit}GB. We recommend using Firefox or Safari for files of this size since they have less limitations.

external_warning.title: External server warning
external_warning.text: If you choose to convert into a video format, those files will be uploaded to an external server to be converted. Do you want to continue?

errors.vertd_server: what are you doing..? you're supposed to run the vertd server!
errors.vertd_generic_body: An error occurred whilst whilst trying convert your video. Would you like to submit this video to the developers to help fix this bug? Only your video file will be sent. No identifiers will be uploaded.
errors.vertd_failed_to_keep: Failed to keep the video on the server: {error}
errors.vertd_details_body: If you press submit, your video will also be attached alongside the error log which is always reported to us for review. The following information is the log that we automatically receive:
errors.vertd_details_footer: This information will only be used for troubleshooting purposes and will never be shared. View our [privacy_link]privacy policy[/privacy_link] for more details.
errors.vertd_ratelimit: Your video, '{filename}', has failed to convert a few times. To prevent server overload, further conversion attempts for this file have been temporarily blocked. Please try again later.
errors.unsupported_format: Only image, video, audio, and document files are supported
errors.format_output_only: This format can currently only be used as output (converted to), not as input.
errors.vertd_not_found: Could not find the vertd instance to start video conversion. Are you sure the instance URL is set correctly?
errors.worker_downloading: The {type} converter is currently being initialized, please wait a few moments.
errors.worker_error: The {type} converter had an error during initialization, please try again later.
errors.worker_timeout: The {type} converter is taking longer than expected to initialize, please wait a few more moments or refresh the page.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.brightness_description: Want a sunny flash-bang, or a quiet lonely night?
appearance.effect_description: Would you like fancy effects, or a more static experience?

conversion.title: Conversion
conversion.filename_description: This will determine the name of the file on download, not including the file extension. You can put these following templates in the format, which will be replaced with the relevant information: %name% for the original file name, %extension% for the original file extension, and %date% for a date string of when the file was converted.
conversion.default_format_description: This will change the default format selected when you upload a file of this file type.
conversion.metadata_description: This changes whether any metadata (EXIF, song info, etc.) on the original file is preserved in converted files.
conversion.quality_description: This changes the default output quality of the converted files (in its category). Higher values may result in longer conversion times and file size.
conversion.quality_video: This changes the default output quality of the converted video files. Higher values may result in longer conversion times and file size.

vertd.title: Video conversion
vertd.description: The vertd project is a server wrapper for FFmpeg. This allows you to convert videos through the convenience of ConvertOnline's web interface, while still being able to harness the power of your GPU to do it as quickly as possible.
vertd.hosting_info: We host a public instance for your convenience, but it is quite easy to host your own on your PC or server if you know what you are doing. You can download the server binaries [vertd_link]here[/vertd_link] - the process of setting this up will become easier in the future, so stay tuned!
vertd.speed_description: This describes the tradeoff between speed and quality. Faster speeds will result in lower quality, but will get the job done quicker.

privacy.title: Privacy & data
privacy.plausible_description: We use [plausible_link]Plausible[/plausible_link], a privacy-focused analytics tool, to gather completely anonymous statistics. All data is anonymized and aggregated, and no identifiable information is ever sent or stored. You can view the analytics [analytics_link]here[/analytics_link] and choose to opt out below.
privacy.cache_description: We cache the converter files on your browser so you don't have to re-download them every time, improving performance and reducing data usage.
privacy.site_data_description: Clear all site data including settings and cached files, resetting ConvertOnline to its default state and reloading the page.
privacy.clear_all_data_confirm: This will reset all settings & cache, then reload the page. This action cannot be undone.
privacy.all_data_cleared: All site data cleared! Reloading page...
privacy.all_data_clear_error: Failed to clear all site data.

language.title: Language
language.description: Select your preferred language for the ConvertOnline interface.

why.title: Why ConvertOnline?
why.description:
File converters have always disappointed us. They're ugly, riddled with ads, and most importantly; slow. We decided to solve this problem once and for all by making an alternative that solves all those problems, and more.

All non-video files are converted completely on-device; this means that there's no delay between sending and receiving the files from a server, and we never get to snoop on the files you convert.

Video files get uploaded to our lightning-fast RTX 4000 Ada server. Your videos stay on there for an hour if you do not convert them. If you do convert the file, the video will stay on the server for an hour, or until it is downloaded. The file will then be deleted from our server.

sponsors.title: Sponsors
sponsors.description: Want to support us? Contact a developer in the [discord_link]Discord[/discord_link] server, or send an email to

donate.title: Donate to ConvertOnline
donate.description: With your support, we can keep maintaining and improving ConvertOnline.
donate.payment_failed: Payment failed: {message}{period} You have not been charged.
donate.donation_error: An error occurred while processing your donation. Please try again later.
donate.payment_error: Error fetching payment details. Please try again later.
donate.donation_notice_official: Your donations here go to the official VERT instance (vert.sh), and helps to support the development of the project.
donate.donation_notice_unofficial: Your donations here go to the operator of this VERT instance. If you wish to support the official VERT developers, please visit [official_link]vert.sh[/official_link] instead.

credits.title: Credits
credits.contact_team: If you would like to contact the development team, please use the email found on the "Resources" card.
credits.notable_description: We'd like to thank these people for their major contributions to VERT.
credits.github_description: Big thanks to all these people for helping out! [github_link]Want to help too?[/github_link]
credits.no_contributors: Seems like no one has contributed yet... [contribute_link]be the first to contribute![/contribute_link]
credits.libraries_description: A big thanks to FFmpeg (audio, video), ImageMagick (images) and Pandoc (documents) for maintaining such excellent libraries for so many years. VERT relies on them to provide you with your conversions.

roles.lead_developer: Lead developer; conversion backend, UI implementation

errors.magick: Error in Magick worker, image conversion may not work as expected.
errors.ffmpeg: Error loading FFmpeg, some features may not work as expected.
errors.pandoc: Error loading Pandoc worker, document conversion may not work as expected.
errors.file_too_large: This file exceeds the {limit}GB browser / device limit. Try Firefox or Safari to convert this large file, which typically have higher limits.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description:
VERT's privacy policy is very simple: we do not collect or store any data on you at all. We don't use cookies or trackers, analytics are completely private, and all conversions (except videos) happen locally on your browser. Videos are deleted after being downloaded, or an hour, unless explicitly given permission by you to be stored; it will only be used for the purpose of troubleshooting. VERT self-hosts a Coolify instance for hosting the website and vertd (for video conversion), and a Plausible instance for completely anonymous and aggregated analytics. We use Stripe to process donations, which may collect some data used for fraud prevention.

Note this may only apply to the official VERT instance at [vert_link]vert.sh[/vert_link]; third-party instances may handle your data differently.

conversions.title: Conversions
conversions.description:
Most conversions (images, documents, audio) happen entirely locally on your device using WebAssembly versions of the relevant tools (e.g. ImageMagick, Pandoc, FFmpeg). This means your files never leave your device and we will never have access to them.

Video conversions are performed on our servers because they require more processing power and cannot be done very quickly on the browser yet. Videos you convert with VERT are deleted after being downloaded, or after one hour, unless you explicitly give permission for us to store them longer purely for troubleshooting purposes.

donations.title: Donations
donations.description: We use Stripe on the [about_link]about[/about_link] page to collect donations. Stripe may collect certain information about the payment and device for fraud prevention as described in [stripe_link]their documentation on advanced fraud detection[/stripe_link]. External network requests to Stripe are deferred, and are only made after you click the button to pay.

conversion_errors.title: Conversion Errors
conversion_errors.description: When a video conversion fails, we may collect some anonymous data to help us diagnose the issue. This data may include:
conversion_errors.list_job_id: The job ID, which is the anonymized file name
conversion_errors.list_stderr: The FFmpeg stderr output of your job (error message)
conversion_errors.list_video: The actual video file (if given explicit permission)
conversion_errors.footer: This information is used solely for the purpose of diagnosing conversion issues. The actual video file will only ever be collected if you give us permission to do so, where it will only be used for troubleshooting.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: We self-host a Plausible instance for completely anonymous and aggregated analytics. Plausible does not use cookies and complies with all major privacy regulations (GDPR/CCPA/PECR). You can opt out of analytics in the "Privacy & data" section in [settings_link]settings[/settings_link] and read more about Plausible's privacy practices [plausible_link]here[/plausible_link].

local_storage.title: Local Storage
local_storage.description:
We use your browser's local storage to save your settings, and your browser's session storage to temporarily store the GitHub contributors list for the "About" section to reduce repeated GitHub API requests. No personal data is stored or transmitted.

The WebAssembly versions of the conversion tools we use (FFmpeg, ImageMagick, Pandoc) are also stored locally on your browser when you first visit the website, so you don't need to redownload them each visit. No personal data is stored or transmitted. You may view or delete this data at any time in the "Privacy & data" section in [settings_link]settings[/settings_link].

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: For questions, email us at: [email_link]hello@vert.sh[/email_link]. If you are using a third-party instance of VERT, please contact the hoster of that instance instead.

what_is.title: What is ConvertOnline?
what_is.description: ConvertOnline is a free, open-source file conversion tool that allows you to convert images, audio, documents, and videos directly on your device using WebAssembly. Unlike traditional file converters, ConvertOnline processes most files locally on your browser, ensuring your files never leave your device and providing fast, private conversions.

supported_formats.title: What file formats are supported?
supported_formats.description:
ConvertOnline supports over 250+ file formats across four main categories:

Images: JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP, BMP, TIFF, SVG, and many more
Audio: MP3, WAV, FLAC, AAC, OGG, M4A, and more
Documents: PDF, DOCX, DOC, TXT, RTF, EPUB, HTML, and more
Video: MP4, AVI, MOV, MKV, WebM, and more

You can see all supported formats when you upload a file and select the conversion format.

file_size.title: Is there a file size limit?
file_size.description: No! ConvertOnline has no file size limits for most conversions. However, very large video files may have browser limitations. For files larger than a few GB, we recommend using Firefox or Safari as they typically have higher memory limits.

conversion_location.title: Where does the conversion happen?
conversion_location.description: Most conversions (images, audio, and documents) happen entirely on your device using WebAssembly. This means your files never leave your computer, ensuring privacy and fast conversion speeds. Video conversions are performed on our servers due to the high processing requirements, but you can also set up your own local video conversion server.

video_conversion.title: How does video conversion work?
video_conversion.description: Video files require more processing power than can be efficiently handled in a browser, so they are uploaded to our servers for conversion. Your videos are automatically deleted after being downloaded, or after one hour if not converted. You can also configure your own local video conversion server in the [settings_link]Settings[/settings_link] page for complete privacy.

filename.title: Can I customize the output filename?
filename.description: Yes! You can customize the filename format in the [settings_link]Settings[/settings_link] page. Use templates like %name% for the original filename, %extension% for the original extension, and %date% for the conversion date. For example, ConvertOnline_%name% will create files like ConvertOnline_photo.jpg.

default_format.title: Can I set a default conversion format?
default_format.description: Yes! In the [settings_link]Settings[/settings_link] page, you can set default conversion formats for each file type (images, videos, audio, documents). When you upload a file, it will automatically select your preferred format, saving you time.

quality.title: How do I adjust conversion quality?
quality.description: You can adjust the conversion quality in the [settings_link]Settings[/settings_link] page. Higher quality settings will result in better output but may take longer to convert and produce larger files. You can set different quality levels for images (percentage), audio (bitrate in kbps), and videos.

metadata.title: Will file metadata be preserved?
metadata.description: You can choose whether to keep or remove metadata (like EXIF data in images, song info in audio files) in the [settings_link]Settings[/settings_link] page. By default, metadata is preserved, but you can remove it for privacy or to reduce file size.

batch.title: Can I convert multiple files at once?
batch.description: Yes! You can upload multiple files at once and convert them all together. Use the "Convert all" button to process all files, or convert them individually. You can also download all converted files as a ZIP archive using the "Download all" button.

errors.title: What should I do if conversion fails?
errors.description: If a conversion fails, you'll see an error message with details. For video conversions, you may be asked if you want to submit the error to help us fix bugs. Common issues include unsupported formats, corrupted files, or browser limitations. Try refreshing the page or using a different browser if problems persist.

cache.title: What is the cache and how do I clear it?
cache.description: ConvertOnline caches converter files in your browser to improve performance and reduce data usage. These cached files are stored locally and don't contain any personal data. You can view or clear the cache in the [settings_link]Settings[/settings_link] page under "Privacy & data".
